Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family”
Reviews.Author: MichaelEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: The Orlando is in an excellent location at the quiet, mostly residential, end of Prinsengracht, which made it very peaceful at night while being only 20 minutes walk from most of the main attractions in the city centre. The hosts were friendly and helpful and made us feel very welcome. We are a family of five, and booked rooms 111 and 112, which meant that we had the basement floor to ourselves. Room 112 in particular was enormous, with plenty of room for all five of us to sit together while 'back at base'. Even though the rooms were in the basement, the huge windows let in plenty of light and air. We enjoyed the breakfasts, which set us up for the day, and found plenty of good places to eat nearly, especially just round the corner in Utrechtsestraat (Tempo Doeloe, for example). Top tip - book in advance online for major attractions (Anne Frank House, Van Gogh Museum) and avoid having to queue - we walked straight past a 90 minute queue to get into the Anne Frank House.

Reviews.Title: “Return visit did not disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: Light03
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the Hotel Orlando. I gave a great review in 2010 and I am pleased to say that the stay here was as good as last time. I stayed here with my mother for 3 nights in February 2012. This time we had a room that had been newly open when I was there last. This is a really lovely room. It is at the back of the hotel, on the ground floor and faces on to a garden. You can also see other canal houses plus their gardens from your window. The room is extra large with almost floor to ceiling windows on one side. The bathroom is clean and spacious. All of this was extra important as I had a really bad cold and needed to stay indoors for a day. The stay in Amsterdam also coincided with the cold snap which hit Europe in February. On the day I stayed in it snowed heavily all day. We were able to watch the snow falling via the large windows â€“ it looked magical. The heating also worked beautifully. Another bonus was the fact that the hotel has a variety of TV channels. I could watch BBC1 and BBC2 and not CNN all day. There is free Wi-Fi as well. I was also able to access the kitchen to prepare my cold medication. Rose and Paul are wonderful hosts. On the first day we arrived early before the room was ready. Rose made us a pot of tea and we warmed ourselves by the fire in the breakfast room. They also helped us with transport and were happy to provide information if needed. Breakfast was good and plentiful â€“ Ham, cheese, boiled eggs, cereal, bread, croissants, tea, coffee, orange juice and yoghurt. We had to leave early on the last day, before the usual breakfast time. Rose arrived earlier at the hotel so that we were able to have breakfast before our departure â€“ much appreciated. Hotel Orlando is in a great location and you can walk to most sites from here. We had dinner each night in Utrechtsestraat. We visited the restaurant Lâ€™Express on two occasions this trip and two occasions on the previous trip. Nice food, well priced. The hotel is perfect for the self sufficient traveller who wants to get a feel of what it would be like to have a canal house as their home. I thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, clean and large rooms, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: basilfriend
Reviews.Content: We booked here for a short 2 night city break and found it to be in a perfect location and within walking distance of the city centre. Lovely views overlooking the Prinsengracht canal, and very comfortable rooms with good showers and plenty of space. Breakfast was served in a small but homely kitchen/dining room and included nice quality breads, pastries, fruit etc. Also plenty of cafes nearby and with access to taxis also. Overall a very pleasant stay and would recommend to anyone (especially families) looking for a well priced, small and friendly hotel in one of Amsterdam's most desirable locations.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: azurebluesky
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a trip with a friend and our two daughters. We stayed for 3 nights in the Orlando. The location is very convenient, about 20 mins walk to the Anne Frank House, and 15 mins or less to the start of the Museum Quarter, for Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum etc. Lots of restaurants and cafes nearby. Located canalside, but away from the bustling centre, it suited us very well. We reached the hotel from Schipol by train to Centraal Station (EUR 3.80 adult, Â£2.50 children) and then taxi from thr station to the hotel (EUR 16). On the way back to the airport the hotel pre-booked us a taxi at EUR 35, which for the 4 of us worked out only a little more than our arrival option (and a lot less hassle with the carrying of bags!) The breakfast was great - delicious freshly squeezed orange juice, eggs, cheese, rolls, yoghurt, hot chocolate for the kids etc.. Very happy with our choice and would happily recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel right on the Prisengracht”
Reviews.Author: saqsaq
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in September. We had room 116, courtyard view and some steep stairs, for our first night and then had arranged to move to room 115, canal view and ground floor, for the next two nights. Both rooms were very nice and clean. Room 116 was very large. The pictures on the website accurately represent the rooms. Both rooms had a mini fridge with some items stocked but we liked that we could put our own items in the fridge. Breakfast was included in the rate and was a nice start to the day, breads, fruit, cereal, cheese, meat, boiled eggs, coffee and fresh OJ. The owner was incredibly helpful, carrying our bags up on the first day, providing us with a good map and help with the transportation system. We took a cab from the central train station on our arrival but used the tram on our departure. It was a 5 minute walk to the tram station. The hotel is in a very nice area with plenty of cafes within walking distance. It was a short walk to Rembrantplein, where there were lots of outdoor cafes and a tram stop. There was also a nice grocery store on the walk to Rembrantplein. We really searched long and hard for a canal view room on a first floor and while I'm glad we found it, you don't really see much of the canal due to the cars and the house boats, so I don't think canal view would be so crucial for the next visit. I really liked the hotel and would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: retiredlady07
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights beginning September 16. This is a lovely little hotel in a very good area. We had a canal view. A very good breakfast with fresh squeezed orange juice. Can't say enough about that. The owner is so helpful and nice. Our room was a spacious room and very comfortable. A very good location. We walked, with our luggage to a tram that took us to the train station on the day of our departure. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice big rooms, quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: tamjm
Reviews.Content: Thanks to tripadvisor contributors for recommending this great little hotel with great big rooms. This hotel isn't in a touristy area of Amsterdam, so you won't find many recommendations on hotels around it in the guidebooks. We were attending a workshop at the University of Amsterdam, a 5 block walk to the east, so it was a perfect location for us. It's also really close to a bunch of good restaurants on Utrechtsestraat. Central Amsterdam is compact, so most of the tourist sites are only a 15 minute walk. And walking around Amsterdam is wonderful. The hosts were really friendly and helpful. It is small B&B, so you basically get a nice large room and a simple breakfast. My only minor complaint is that the breakfast was a bit repetitive. But if you're here for a couple days, you wouldn't even notice. Also, if you're traveling with someone with mobility issues, you might ask for a room on the ground floor. The spiral staircase is pretty steep.

Reviews.Title: “Great base in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: hmhmhm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Orlando for 4 nights at the end of April. The hotel is well located in a slightly less touristy area of Amsterdam, but it was still convenient to walk to all the major tourist attractions (if you don't mind a bit of walking). We even walked from the main train station to the hotel with our luggage on the first day - it's doable, but I'd recommend catching the tram (it's a fair walk and took about 20 mins). Our room was on the ground floor, along the hallway. It was spacious and quiet and the beds were large and comfortable. The room was very clean, except for the TV cabinet, which was super dusty! Breakfast was above average and ample - fresh orange juice, ham, cheese, croissant, yoghurt, fresh fruit. The service was good - I can't remember her name, but the lady who served us each morning was very friendly and helpful and spoke perfect English. They were happy to let us use their computer and printer for internet banking, printing entry tickets, etc. Tips: - we're young and fairly fit, but I'm glad we didn't book a room upstairs as it would've been a massive struggle to get our luggage up the narrow, steep stairs (although, I'm not sure if they are able to lift your luggage up for you from the outside through the window); - there is a Spanish tapa restaurant nearby, Patta Negra (http://www.pata-negra.nl/), that was very good; and - a trip down the canals with the St Nicholaas Boat Club (http://amsterdamboatclub.com/) was a highlight!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Welcoming, Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: LongReefHacker
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in a ground floor room with a window onto a small garden. The room was spacious, ceilings very high and the bathroom also large and very functional. Since I have suspect knees, the stone mushroom stool in the bathroom was a great touch. It's so much easier to dry yourself after a shower when you can perch each foot up at about knee level. The bed (two singles butted together, normal Dutch style) was very soft and comfortable and we slept well. Breakfast was the usual continental (and was included in the tariff) but was of good quality. Excellent, varied breads with fruit juices, cereals, yoghurt and plenty of cheese and meats. The breakfast room is very pleasant, sunny and lookinmg onto a much more substantial garden. There is no cable TV (just locally available channels, including BBC World News in English). The room had a well-stocked bar fridge but no tea/coffee making facilities. Location is excellent, right on the Prinzengracht, one of Amsterdam's principal canals, and about 50m from a tram route direct to/from Centraal. There are plenty of bars and eateries within 500m. We wanted a central location with a comfortable, clean room, good bed, good bathroom with plenty of hot water and a reasonable breakfast at a good value tariff. Orlando delivered. We will certainly use this hotel when next in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful small hotel on the Prinsengracht”
Reviews.Author: AlixAuckland
Reviews.Content: We first stayed here 7 years ago and it was a delight to return and experience this small hotel's ambience. We were guests in a spacious old Amsterdam canal house. The hotel is superbly situated in the museum quarter, an easy walk to the Rijksmuseum and to the new Hermitage Museum in Amsterdam. The antique quarter is around the corner and the Flower Market not far away but this section of the Prinsengracht is peaceful. Paul prepares a good breakfast and is a friendly and knowledgeable host. Book well ahead and ask for a ground floor room because the stairs are steep.

Reviews.Title: “All good but for the cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: Bristol_D-Man
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Very helpul staff. Lovely breakfast. However, the level of cleanliness was insufficient. The walls were in desperate need of repainting and the floor needed a proper hoovering. The bathroom was also not properly cleaned. The hotel is right on the street, and thus noise could be a problem, though it was not for us.

Reviews.Title: “Very restful location”
Reviews.Author: SuffolkInterrailer
Reviews.Content: An excellent location at the Amstel end of the Prinsengracht with excellent bars and restaurants nearby, this small hotel of five rooms, all in immaculate order, is a gem. If you would like an alternative view try the room overlooking the garden at the rear, with large windows, high ceiling and large en suite bathroom. Very friendly proprietors have taken great care to offer a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Light03
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Hotel Orlando for 6 nights in October/November 2010. It felt like home and was a great base to explore Amsterdam. The beds were comfrotable and the room large and very clean. We stayed in 115 which looked on to the canal. This was perfect for us because it was on the ground floor and saved mum from climbing stairs. The street was quiet at night. The rooms are spacious with high ceilings. Breakfast was made up of bread, ham, cheese, boiled eggs, yoghurt and coffee/tea and orange juice. This set us up for the day and we did not eat a meal until dinner time. Location is wonderful. It is within walking distance of most sites even though it looks a little far away on the map, it really isn't. A stop/go bus passes the hotel frequently and follows the Prinsengracht. You can flag it down and it will take you up down the canal. You can then walk through to Dam square etc. We used this bus frequently. It stops at the train station and one trip costs 1 euro. If you crave night life then Rembrandtplein is just up the street and there are many restaurants which we frequented on Utrechtsestraat nearby. There is also a small supermarket and laundromat very close by. I left my camera on the stop/go bus and with the help of Paul the owner of Hotel Orlando, I managed to get it back 6 hours after I had lost it. Paul kindly made phone calls and drove me to the bus depot on the outskirts of Amsterdam to retrieve my camera. Paul and his colleague Rose were wonderful to us and provided us with advice, called taxis for us and made us feel like we were staying at someone's home. Paul has opened some new rooms and they sound gorgeous. If you want to stay in a Canal house and leave feeling that you have been staying at a friends house then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient, friendly hotel in Central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: BillEmison
Reviews.Content: Very clean and quaint hotel in central Amsterdam - I recommend it! My girlfriend and I stayed here for two (2) nights and would definitely return in the future. Nice Dutch breakfast in the morning and very comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect base for exploring Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Xayna
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying at Hotel Orlando, on the recommendation of my parents who have stayed there previously. They booked three nights in the hotel for us as a wedding present and we decided to go on the first bank holiday in May. Although we knew it was Queen's Day when we arrived on the Friday, we were not prepared for the spectacle that met us! The Dutch certainly know how to party! However, we found the hotel no problem, even though we were not able to be dropped outside, and we were in room 117. This light, airy and spacious room, complete with three windows overlooking the canal, provided us with the perfect base to sit and watch the festivities outside. The room came complete with a safe, TV and mini-bar, as well as a large, clean and modern bathroom with a great shower. The beds, although twins, were extemely comfortable and the hotel was charming. As it only has five rooms, you don't feel like you are in a large chain and it was very peaceful - with the exception of the party outside! Breakfast was wonderful - although continental in style, it was tasty and filling and set us up well for the day. Each day we had lovely rye bread, fresh croissants, bread rolls, ham, cheese, boiled egg, fresh orange, fantastic fresh coffee and a yogurt. The hotel is perfectly situated for exploring Amsterdam, both in terms of the sights and the restaurants and bars. We found the city small enough that we were able to walk everywhere, but there are always the options of the canal boat and the tram as well. Although there is no front desk at the hotel, we saw Rose every day at breakfast and they couldn't do enough for us in terms of booking a taxi to the airport, allowing us to leave our bags there on the day we checked out etc. All in all, a fantastic hotel and we would highly recommend it to any independent traveller visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, great location and VERY clean !!”
Reviews.Author: andriette
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Orlando last week and would really recommend it to anyone who would like to explore Amsterdam as a tourist. Its location is central with loads of nice places to eat just around the corner. The room I stayed in, 116, was large, clean and very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “great location - spacious room”
Reviews.Author: graceh9
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel (5 rooms) in an excellent location for visiting Amsterdam. The room was spacious and equipped with internet and refrigerator and safe -- 3 very nice things to have. Comfortable bed and nice bathtub. There is no common lobby or area. And no real proprietor presence to provide advice or assistance. The owner was there when we arrived at time expected and he also arranged to leave breakfast items available so we could get our own breakfast of sorts the final morning when we needed to get off early to make our plane. We were grateful for that. We had a real sense of privacy which we value in Amsterdam. It is fairly pricey for value received; the breakfast in particular is pretty lame (except for the excellent OJ). Overall, we were pleased and really loved the location -- but compared with other places we stayed on the trip it was expensive for what was provided. We also had a garden rather than canal view -- that was what was available, but if booking, the canal rooms are really much more attractive and worth asking for. We paid as much as charged for the room across the hall with the great canal view. And on a visit to Amsterdam earlier in the summer, we paid much less for a full apartment with canal view.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, spacious and nice bedroom, people very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Biloba64
Reviews.Content: Very nice bedroom, quite large, very clean, and also very comfortable Small hotel, so that you almost feel at home (5 bedrooms). Very quiet area along a lovely canal and well located. People are also very friendly. The only minor drawback could be the breakfast that is not very frugal.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a good location - recommended”
Reviews.Author: DavidYork
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in a large room (117) overlooking Prinsengracht canal. The room was attractive with some nice deco-style furniture. The hotel is in a good location, with a tram stop a short distance away (100m or so) so you can get anywhere pretty quickly. There was also a hopper bus service running along the whole of Prinsegracht which was very useful e.g. you can flag it down outside the hotel and travel straight to the Anne Frank house. The location is a nice area with several good bars and restaurants - some round the corner on Utrechstrasse looked very good if you're feeling affluent. It felt like a relatively quiet and safe area - possibly helped by the fact there's a police station a few metres away. Breakfast was enjoyable - ham, cheese, jams, freshly warmed bread and croissants, good coffee and freshly squeezed orange juice.

Reviews.Title: “simple and stylish”
Reviews.Author: stylishexplorer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orlando for two nights and had 2 rooms. They were both very stylish and clean. The stairs of a canal house are very narrow and steep so it would be wise to take two small bags rather than one large one. The breakfast was very enjoyable We had freshly squeezed orange juice , good coffee, a boiled egg and delicious bread. There are many restaurants only 5 mins walk away.. The owner Paul was very friendly and helpful. This is a really good location and very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Understated canal side comfort and relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Boingy_breaks
Reviews.Content: We love Amsterdam. We lived there for a year almost 10 years ago and like to go back once a year to say hello. So we've stayed in a few different hotels. Amsterdam is an expensive city hotel wise, it's hard to find something decent for a reasonable purse. We've often played safe and stayed at the luxury end in the Pulitzer or the like but this time thought we'd try a budget option and came across Hotel Orlando. We were very pleasantly surprised - we stayed in room 117, 1st floor overlooking Prinsengracht. The room was the width of the whole canal house, 3 large windows letting in lots of light in to the huge room. Ok, the furniture has probably seen better days, beds a little soft, but has charm and is tastefully put together. It feels homely. And even though really it's a B&B there is a mini-bar that does have reasonable prices if you just want a little drink in your room. The greeting was extremely friendly, the easiest check-in we've ever experienced anywhere in the world and immediately the room was ours for the weekend. The stay felt very authentically Dutch. Breakfast was fine, hot drinks, bread, eggs and cheese/ham to get you started. There are so many lovely cafes and patisseries nearby you can always nip up the road to get something more substantial if need be, and Amsterdam is a city of food so you'd be wise not to eat too big a breakfast and spoil your opportunity for a good lunch. I found the last review here very strange - opposite of our findings. It was extremely relaxing and very sweet, and beautiful and well located. Did feel like a little look at what it would be like to live in a canal house. I would thoroughly recommend Hotel Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “A big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: TravellingScribe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are just back after a two-night stay at Hotel Orlando and, on re-reading previous reviews of this hotel, we have just asked ourselves incredulously: were we at the same place? On the positive side: the hotel is well placed for seeing Amsterdam, being away from the noise and general grubbiness of the inner city but within easy reach by foot (or tram) of all main attractions. The bedlinen was clean; at least one of the twin beds pushed together to form the double was comfortable; there was a hairdryer in the bathroom and a mini fridge in the bedroom; and the young woman who showed us the room, made breakfast and handled check-out was extremely pleasant and friendly. The negatives, however, were considerable. We had chosen Room 111 because we liked the look (from the hotel's website) of the courtyard outside and because we like fresh air when we sleep (however cold it is). However, the photos did NOT show that the ceiling was so low that we barely scraped in, nor that the so-called courtyard (perhaps photographed immediately after renovation?) was now just a damp, rather dingy area inaccessible to guests (unless you wanted to climb out the window). The bathroom had no exterior window or any kind of working ventilation system so became extremely steamy and was no doubt the reason why the paintwork above the tiled area of the shower recess was dark with mould. The grouting of the wall tiles around the handbasin area was also mouldy and the timber benchtop was showing its age with water spotting. We had read comments on the hotel's website about the tastefulness of the interior decor and were amused to see that this translated into two plastic tub chairs, one plastic footstool, a plastic table, and on the tiny bedside tables were Ikea-style bedside lights of which one was temperamental and didn't always light. There was also a strange lattice arrangement painted bright red (but with the paint scuffed around the base) that housed the mini fridge and the TV. Behind and extruding from this curious item was a huge tangle of white plastic wiring that obviously no none could be bothered to coil up and stow away neatly. My husband reported that his bed was extremely lumpy and uncomfortable. The only items that could perhaps be described as antiques were the bathroom towels which were so thin that they were like rags after one use. I peeked in a vacated upstairs room (I didn't note the number) and didn't see any sign of tasteful decor there either - just the bare minimum of ordinary furniture required to classify as a hotel room. Other Trip Advisor reviews commented favourably on the breakfast - again, to our amazement. The coffee was good and plentiful but the food consisted of a few slices of the cheapest kind of sliced cheese and processed ham, one croissant, 3 small rolls and two slices of dark supermarket style "foam" bread, small pots of jam and marmalade, and two tubs of supermarket fruit yoghurt. There was the offer of a boiled egg and orange juice but we declined. I mean - OK but nothing to get excited about. If Hotel Orlando has been at one stage as previous reviews and the hotel's own website suggest, then I can only assume that in the interim its owner has lost interest. European cities can be pricey - having travelled to many parts of the world and now living in Germany, we know that full well - but I am sure that 110 euros a night can find you a better option in Amsterdam than Room 111 at Hotel Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful relaxing canal-side hotel”
Reviews.Author: joetwick
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights around my wife's birthday, we both loved the hotel. Rooms are large and comfortable, with mini bar, tv, and beautiful original paintings. Spent more time than expected just sitting in the room relaxing. Great location on one of the 3 main canals. Far enough out of the center to avoid the noise and stag-dos, but close enough to walk or jump on a tram into the main tourist areas. Utrechtstraat is an adjacent street with a wide variety of restaurants, both the ones we tried were really good. Lots of shops too. Breakfast is very filling and tasty, can even be delivered to the room. All the staff very helpful and friendly, especially the owner, and couldn't have been more welcoming in a relaxed and unobtrusive way. All in all a really great hotel, and perfect if you just want to unwind and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely except for the beds”
Reviews.Author: Mechtilde
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel with beautiful rooms. I had a canalside room on the 1st floor (2nd American). Fantastic view, and the room was huge. Everything was very clean, minibar was nice to have, and the staff were very kind and helped me get my bag up the stairs, which I needed because I've had a back injury. Which brings me to the only caution I would offer: If you need a firm bed, stay someplace else. I fortunately had a couch in my room, and for the two nights I stayed there I alternated between the couch and the floor. It was a painful experience, but if you don't mind a soft bed, you'll probably love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Relaxing, Love the Orlando”
Reviews.Author: funmegg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a really great area. Its a quiet street on a canal, but the large streets near by have a really excellent selection of restaurants, bars and shops. Paul, and his friend who helped out as well, were just great. Breakfast in the morning was a highlight. The hotel has all of the necessities, and the back lower floor bedroom was even quiet during Queens Day. Really private, too. We really enjoyed the hotel and the hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: dgadrienne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and were thrilled with the size of the room/bathroom and the location. We stayed in room 115 on the main floor overlooking the canal. It was nice and roomy with two huge windows to let the light in. It was clean and fresh and welcoming. You can hear traffic and people outside a bit so if you sleep lightly have ear plugs handy or ask for a garden room. The breakfast was prepared daily by Paul and consisted of a poached egg, yogurt, bread with meat, cheese and jams and coffee/tea. It was a simple Dutch breakfast that was very tasty and pleasant. In the breakfast room is Paul's computer which he is happy to let you use for email, as well as guide books and maps. The location is great as the tram from Centraal Station is just at the end of the block and you can walk easily to the Leidseplein, Museumplein and Rembrandtplein. We had dinner at the Italian restaurant near the tram stop and it was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing week in a very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeeTX
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 6 nights and loved all of it. After 40 years of marriage and being informal we don't want glitz and glamour, just clean, quiet, and comfortable. Orlando is all that and more. We had room 114, on the main floor looking out on the courtyard. The room was huge (almost 25 x 30) with a very large bath, both with 12 foot ceilings. Furnishings are in excellent condition, and included a table with 2 chairs, small refrigerator, safe, and TV. Fronting on the canal means no major traffic noise at any time, but the tram stop is only 30 yards away. Within 3 blocks there are more than a dozen restaurants and bars (most of which serve light food too), as well as a pastry shop, a terrific deli, and a stunning cheese shop. Most of the clientele in these places are locals who live in the area, so you really feel like you are in the middle of their life rather than in with a bunch of tourists. We did not need it, but there is a Laundromat 1 block away. We ended up eating two meals in our room, once from a take-out-only Thai shop and once a light meal of cheese and deli items that started as an appetizer and ended up being dinner. The Orlando staff is terrific, but they definitely exhibit the Dutch casual attitude; if you want fancy uniforms and "jump to it" response, they don't have it. But every thing you need is there, and they are very accommodating. I had not brought my laptop to check email, but for Paul it was no problem letting me use his computer in the breakfast room for 10 minutes each morning to check my email. We had a problem with a blown fuse on a personal item late on one day, and the next morning Jergen told me exactly where I could get a replacement (a shop about 6 blocks away). I can only hope that we'll have the chance to go back and that all the other places we stay end up being as wonderful as the Orlando was.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - a must return”
Reviews.Author: handleyr
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Orlando, paying â‚¬100 per night for room 111. I really enjoyed my stay, with the hotel being right on the canal belt, it was really nice. Finding the hotel is really easy, the Prinsengracht tram stop (tram 4) is a 2 minute walk away at the top of the street. Tram 4 goes to Centraal Station and takes between 5 and 15 minutes depending on the traffic. On arrival, we were let into the hotel by Paul, who was very pleasant, and show out room. We arrived at 11ish in the morning, which was no problem, we were shown to our room and given a guided tour. The room was huge. Double bed, table and chairs, TV with BBC 1 and 2 (good for watching match of the day), free safe, large wardrobe space all really nice. The bed were comfy and the shower was quite large too with a constant supply of warn water no matter what the time. The room had a patio door that opened out into a small courtyard, like a small back garden, with a water feature and some kind of statue. We were given keys to the front door and told to come and go as we please. The hotel its self only has 5 rooms, so it was quiet and the other guests were pretty friendly. On the last day we checked out at 10ish, leaving our stuff in the breakfast room so we could make the most of the rest of the day. Everything about the Orlando was straight forward and made really easy for us. Directly opposite our room was the breakfast room. Continental breakfast is included with the cost. Plenty of tea, coffee, fruit juices, breds and cheese and meats on offer here. There was also a free computer with Internet access and an info section where you can get maps and stuff. The breakfast room is always open so you can make your self a drink when you get in at night. Other info - Nearest Coffee Shop is Barneys Lounge, and its a good one. - You are basically a 5 minute walk away from Rembrandtplein where there are a number of bars, restaurants and shops. Cocos Outback is the place to watch the football, plus they do unlimited ribs for â‚¬20. - There is a police station about 5 houses down the street from the Orlando so really itâ€™s in a safe area - Book things in advance, take advantage of the fast track systems in place and donâ€™t waste your time queuing with the other peasants (Anne Franks, The Dungeons etc) - Get your all day tram passes from the white building opposite to Centraal Station When I return to Amsterdam, I will defiantly be contacting the Orlando as I would defiantly stop here again

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Schmoggs
Reviews.Content: We adored the Orloando. It is located right on the canal and our room was right at the front which looked out onto the canal. Our room was giant with 2 double beds and giant TV and an absoluetly gorgeous bathroom with big bath. The whole place was spotlessly clean and the staff were amazingly kind. Breakfast was great (included in the price) downstairs. Freshly squeezed orange juice, eggs, cheese, spreads, rolls and meat - great way to start the day and lots of information phamplets and guide books lying around to read. We stayed here for 2 days and wished that it was longer.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: rubygirlstockholm
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the ground floor with a canal view. The room was simple but stylish and very clean. The bathroom was modern and in tip-top condition - lovely! Basic but good breakfast, friendly and accomodating service. Nice location â€“ central but not busy, and walking distance to some nice shops and restaurants (try out Beddingtons just a street away). Despite the proximity to the street and our room being near the we had two quiet nights and slept vey well. Very good value for money - will definitely stay here again if we come back! / Alison and Carl

Reviews.Title: “As good as I was hoping!”
Reviews.Author: debstah
Reviews.Content: After I made my reservation for my August 15-19 stay (about halfway through a 6-week 10-city trip through Europe) at the Hotel Orlando, some negative reviews popped up here at TA and I got a bit nervous. Then when we arrived at the hotel and rang the bell, twice, and no one answered, I was also a bit nervous. But I guess the third time is a charm and finally Paul let us in, showed us our room (room 111, huge and downstairs across from the absolutely lovely breakfast room), explained some things to us, and we were all settled. Room 111 is supposedly the smallest of the hotel's 5 rooms, but if it is the smallest, I can't imagine how huge the other rooms must be. One room is on the main floor where the entrance is, the other 3 are up what appeared to be a very steep narrow winding staircase typical of the Amsterdam canal houses, and 111 is down a straight and relatively ordinary but short flight of stairs, so access to this room is easier than some of the others. The room is huge. Two beds, a TV getting over 30 channels (many English), a huge closet/mirror thing along one wall, a little table to sit at, and a piece of furniture containing the TV, a little safe (which we were freely given the key to with our room keys), and a minibar with fridge we could use for our own things (the prices for the minibar were about 2 euros for all the drinks, which I didn't think was too bad). Everything in the room was in great shape and very clean. The room opens onto a little courtyard, meaning it is incredibly quiet and we cracked the window open even during the cool nights just to get a little air. The bathroom is also good-sized and has a shower that is very spacious and plenty of room to lay out toiletries, etc. There are plenty of plugs in the room for charging things, and a little table and chairs that was nice to be able to spread out papers, leave the keys, eat snacks, etc. A nice surprise was a free ethernet cable to plug my laptop in. This wasn't advertised and I wasn't expecting any internet connection at such a small establishment, but it was a really welcome touch. We had no problems with Paul (although I am not sure which of the two Pauls we dealt with!). He was very helpful and was never rude. He wasn't the warmest person I've ever encountered, but he was perfectly cordial and happy to help us when we had a problem opening the door (had to pull the handle towards us to turn the key, no problem once he showed us). On Saturday and Sunday morning, another young man was in the breakfast room. I believe he was just an employee there temporarily and unfortunately I did not get his name, but he was unbelievably nice and we chatted for a while each of the mornings he was there serving breakfast. The location is great - it is on a quiet part of the Prinsengracht canal just a couple long blocks from the Rembrandtplein - there are tons of restaurants within a 5-10 minute walk and the Tram #4 which goes to the station and to Dam Square and other tourist places is right at the end of the street a half block away from the hotel at Utrechtstraat (a street lined with stores, restaurants, bakeries, a bank with ATM, and more). Being so close to the tram made it easy and convenient to take the tram back from the sightseeing when my feet were tired. But everything important in town is probably a half hour away or less - and made easier by the tram. As the real heart of Amsterdam can be a crazy place, I personally really enjoyed the peaceful respite of the Hotel Orlando's quiet and peaceful location. But if you want to stay right in the heart of all the action and don't mind noise and drunkards and litter 24/7, this is probably not the hotel for you and you might want to look for a place more in the middle of all the action. Breakfast is continental, but very nice. Freshly-squeezed (sometimes right in front of your eyes!) orange juice was a really nice touch, a big cup of yogurt, slices of excellent cheese and also some ham, two kinds of bread/rolls with amazing quality butter (you know the butter must be good when someone can actually tell that it tastes good!), very good coffee, a selection of teas should you want it, a boiled egg, and a couple of jams if you want. Paul or whoever is there in the morning serves you everything and it is a nice little classy room and nice service. It was a little boring after 4 days but more than enough to start the day with. It does start a little bit late, breakfast is from 9-11am, but this was never a problem for me. The only thing that was even slightly off was that on Saturday, I returned from my day of sight-seeing and my room wasn't cleaned. It didn't bother me in the slightest, and I don't know if it was a one-off or if they don't clean on Saturdays or whatever, but if this is an issue for you, maybe check and make sure the room will be cleaned every day. Keep in mind that this is a canal house and that the owners live in the building. Therefore, for disabled visitors, booking room 115 would be a must as no stairs inside are required to get to that room (though as I said, breakfast is downstairs). As with almost all of the canal houses, there is no elevator and outside the building there are about 6 or so stairs. We booked right with the hotel's website via email and paid 100 euros for the room when it was 2 of us and after my friend went home halfway through our stay, it was 85 euros for just me - a very good deal. Another convenience is that even though the hotel is small, they happily accepted credit cards for the room payment with no surcharge. All in all I can't recommend the hotel enough. It is so unfortunate that some people had bad experiences with the hotel and/or Paul - the only thing I can think of is that perhaps he was going through a bad time or something and unfortunately took it out on his hotel or his guests. But I really enjoyed my time there and would recommend it to anyone and would definitely stay there again should I ever return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “We will return one day!”
Reviews.Author: myu7
Reviews.Content: After much research, we booked hotel orlando and we loved this hotel. I stayed in Room 117 with my parents from July 21-23, 2007. The three huge windows bring the room a lot of light. The decor is classy and make you feel calm and warm. The canal is right outside our window. Paul serves breakfast in the basement, which has custom-made utensils and furnitures. He played opera every morning. He does not speak a lot. But you can tell he is a kind and well-educated person. The woman lives next door to the hotel has two small childen. She waved to us one morning and we had a nice converstion with her. It is the homely ambience that makes Hotel orlando special. I hope I will return one day and stay in room 117 again. Mia.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Zuca
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on the internet and surpassed my expectations. It's a friendly hotel... Small with spacious rooms, peaceful and central. You're near of everything. It's located near a police station. For a mid range hotel, it was very confortable. Surely i'll be back in my next visit to Amsterdam...

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed stay”
Reviews.Author: Kaahele_wannabe
Reviews.Content: I can understand the mixed reviews of the Hotel Orlando. We enjoyed our stay in Amsterdam, but it wasn't necessarily because of the hotel. Hotel Orlando is nice, more like a B&B, but we met friendlier staff at other B&Bs. This is not to say that Paul is not friendly. He is just not as warm, as some American tourists might expect an owner to be. Nevertheless, we enjoyed room 115. it was spacious (enough, by European standards), and the bathroom was fine (and clean). Do note that because this is a first floor room, it is at street level and can be a little noisy. Bring earplugs and you'll be fine. We did not have breakfast any of the three days we were there. If you can wait until closer to lunchtime, check out The Pancake House...it is walking distance away. Also, we arrived in Amsterdam very early in the morning and unfortunately our room was not ready. He knew the time we were arriving, but that was okay - it helped us with the jet lag to stay awake. Another tip - if you have heavy luggage request room 115 - that way you won't have to lug your bags up the narrow stairs. Enjoy Amsterdam! *p.s...sorry for the bad pics, these photos do not do the room justice.

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedTravelers
Reviews.Content: This not a hotel, but basically a bed and breakfast. The room was huge and very clean. The bathroom was average size, but the towels were pretty thin. While the room technically has air conditioning it really was useless, but the fan made up for it. Breakfast consisted of some bread, cheese, ham and a hard boiled egg - pretty standard Dutch fare. The owner (Paul) could not be more accomodating. The location is very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Sparkey79
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed in 2 rooms in Hotel Orlando last weekend and loved it. Our rooms were located at the back of the hotel, one in the basement and one on the ground floor. We heard no noise at night and slept soundly. I am not sure about the rooms on the upper floors, the stairs up to them looked very steep but this is common in Amsterdam. The rooms and bathrooms were comfortable, spacious and clean. There is no reception in the hotel, you are given a key and come and go as you please. During our 3 days we dealt with a young woman and man who were both very helpful and accomodating. They gave us maps and marked out all the places we wished to visit, recommended restaurants to us, and it was no problem storing our bags as we had an evening flight home. They even put a 3rd bed in one of the rooms for us at a very small extra cost. The breakfast consisted of fresh orange juice, coffee/tea, warm rolls & brown bread, cheese, ham, egg and yogurt. We found it very good. I feel the best thing about the hotel is its location. It is a lovely house situated facing a canal on a quiet safe street (police station few doors up). At the top of the street there are plenty of shops, bars and restuarants. It is 3 streets away from rembrantplein which has great nightlife, a 10 min walk from waterlooplein market, albert cruypt market and the flower market, and very accessible to the city centre. I feel the hotel and location really made our trip - I had previously stayed in hotels near damrak and central station - but much preferred this location!!! It was very peaceful and relaxing yet easy walking distance to the city centre. One thing to be careful of it that some taxi drivers are not sure of the location as it is a very small hotel, it is handy to have it marked on a map for them!!! I think the Hotel Orlando is great value and would highly recommend it. My friends and I are already planning our next trip back =0)

Reviews.Title: “Over rated”
Reviews.Author: Mississppiview
Reviews.Content: I agree with the reviewers who noted the cleanliness (or lack thereof) and the somewhat odd or rude behavior of the staff. This hotel is recommended in so many trusted guides including Louis Vuitton! Not by me. My bathroom had peeling paint, mold and stains on the ceiling. The room was dusty as others mentioned and the bed was two twin beds shoved together that seperated easily and made sleeping uncomfortable. I also was awakened by many loud pedestrians outside during the night. The breakfast was a joke. I was asked what time I wanted it and when I told him I could just have some bread and cheese he acted mad that he had even bothered to get up and make it for me. There was no alternative to orange juice and I am unable to drink it. I asked for milk instead and there was none. I was never offered yogurt or an egg. I feel the price I paid was more than was warranted. I think I should expect more for $200/night. I would have preferred a clean hotel with more choices for a breakfast for this price. (Cereal/musli, a variety of juices and beverages, breads, meat and cheese as most offer) I also did not find the staff helpful as to places to see or directions. The praises for the owner I read about I did not see - I think there are two men named Paul - one the owner and one his "partner" I think the odd one is the partner. I never met the other one. P.S. The room is exactly as pictured by other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff, Location, and Price”
Reviews.Author: rcurry01
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for one night while we were on a 24 hour layover at Schipol on our way to South Africa for our honeymoon. The manager Paul could not have been more accommodating to our needs! We had earlier arranged with Paul that we would have an early arrival due to our inbound flight from the States. We arrived at 9:00 am, and Paul brought us into the breakfast room and offered us something to eat with the other guests. This was such a nice touch considering that we would not be able to have breakfast the next morning due to our early flight. Since we were there so early, Paul very apologetically informed us that our room would not be ready until 11:00am. Quite honestly we were so impressed that it would be ready that early! We set off wandering the city for an hour and by the time we came back, the room was ready. We paid for a smaller room, but were given one of their standard rooms. The room was HUGE by European standards. It consisted of a king bed (two twins pushed together), a couch, desk, dresser, and mini-bar. We could have held dance in the middle of the room it was so big. The bathroom was simple and clean, and the shower pressure was awesome. Donâ€™t come here expecting a fancy bathroom, because you wonâ€™t get it; it is very utilitarian. The hotel is set on an idyllic street right next to a police station so it is very safe. It is not a rowdy street or hotel so if you are coming to Amsterdam to party this may not be the hotel for you. If you are looking for something romantic this is perfect. Overall this hotel was exactly what we were looking for on our one night stay in Amsterdam. For the price you canâ€™t beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: AnnieBirmingham
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Orlando in March with three female friends. The whole stay was coloured by the the extremely rude and frankly odd behaviour of the only staff member whom we had any particular contact with (I qualify this by saying we did meet one other female staff member who was polite and helpful). Paul (as I think he was called) made us feel like unwanted house guests, everything was too much trouble for him. Our rooms weren't cleaned while we were staying there, the mini bar was disgusting inside and half empty. We were given out of date yogurts for breakfast (which we only discovered after we had eaten them). On the day we left Paul told us we had to check out ASAP as he had to clean the rooms (so it seems some cleaning is done). We had been under the impression check out time was 12.00 but apparently it was 11.00, Paul told us at 10.50 while we were having breakfast that we had to check out at 11.00, so naturally we were going to be running a little late. We finished breakfast and went to our rooms to get our stuff together. Paul then came and started banging on our doors telling us he needed the rooms and was quite aggressive, the whole situation was really uncomfortable. When we came to settle the bill he said we were incompatible and "huffed and puffed" further. Having worked in a hotel previously myself I was quite shocked by his behaviour, he was thoroughly unprofessional, you don't have to like your customers or be compatible with them, you just have to to your job. Maybe he was having a bad week, he spelt "unwashed" shall we say and his behaviour was quite erratic. We had one of the bigger rooms and one of the smaller rooms and they were a generally both good sizes, although not very clean and the beds weren't particularly comfortable. The bathrooms were basic but fine. On the basis of the service we received I can't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Visit”
Reviews.Author: Cambridgevisitor
Reviews.Content: Splendid. We were in Amsterdam for a wedding and stayed for a long weekend. We also had the absolutely vast Room 117 overlooking the Prinsengracht. It's super...spacious yet romantic. Nice big bathroom too. Comfy beds and stylish decor. Mandy was warm and helpful and got us hairdryer, iron &c. Location excellent. The smallness is an absolutely huge plus. You feel special and as though you have really discovered somewhere. Only very slight negative was that parts of the room including the intriguing TV/Bar box hadn't been dusted and were a little dirty. ...but that's not enough to detract from my 5. We would definitely stay here again...if there was space.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Orlando
HotelInfo.Address: Prinsengracht 1099, Amsterdam 1017 JH, The Netherlands
